meanings.definition: Produce or provide (a natural, agricultural, or industrial product)
meanings.sent1: The apple tree yields delicious fruits every autumn.
meanings.sent2: The farm yields a bountiful harvest of vegetables each year.
meanings.sent3: The garden gnome joked that the soil yields magic beans at midnight.
meanings.sent4: Her hard work in the kitchen yields a masterpiece of a cake.
meanings.sent5: The sunflower yields its seeds to the hungry birds.

meanings.definition: Give way to pressure or force
meanings.sent1: The door easily yields to a gentle push.
meanings.sent2: The old bridge finally yields under the weight of the heavy truck.
meanings.sent3: The stubborn lock finally yields to the determined locksmith.
meanings.sent4: The ice cream yields to the warmth of the summer sun.
meanings.sent5: The sandcastle yields to the incoming tide.

meanings.definition: Surrender or submit to a superior force or authority
meanings.sent1: The defeated army yields to the victorious general.
meanings.sent2: The captured spy yields valuable information under interrogation.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten yields to the stern gaze of its owner.
meanings.sent4: The rebellious teenager finally yields to his parents' rules.
meanings.sent5: The wild horse yields to the skilled horse whisperer.
